questions.question: The antononym of PERNICIOUS is:
The antoynm of `harbinger‚Äô is-
DEMISE: Antonym ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..
Submission: Yielding::
questions.explanation: 1. Submission : This word refers to the act of yielding or surrendering to a higher authority or accepting the will or authority of another. It implies compliance or obedience. 2. Yielding : This word means giving way to pressure or force; surrendering or giving up one's position or opinion. It is closely related to submission as it denotes the action of conceding or acquiescing. Now, let's analyze the options provided: 1. Subjection: Liberation : This pair represents the opposite relationship of submission and yielding. "Subjection" implies being under control or domination, whereas "liberation" signifies freedom or release from such control. 2. Restrain: Indulge : This pair represents a contrasting relationship, where "restrain" means to hold back or restrict, while "indulge" means to allow oneself to enjoy something freely. 3. Compliant: Acquiescent : These words represent a similar relationship to "submission: yielding." "Compliant" means inclined to agree with or obey rules, while "acquiescent" means accepting something reluctantly but without protest. Both suggest a willingness to yield or give in to a certain extent. 4. Restriction: Relaxation : This pair represents the opposite relationship of submission and yielding. "Restriction" implies a limitation or control, whereas "relaxation" signifies the absence of such limitations, suggesting freedom. Given the definitions and relationships between the words, the pair that best mirrors the relationship between "submission: yielding" is: ‡¶ó. Compliant: Acquiescent Because both terms imply a willingness to yield or give in to something, reflecting the relationship between submission and yielding.

questions.question: Distort: Twist ::
questions.explanation: In the analogy "Distort: Twist ::", we are looking for a pair of words that have a similar relationship to "distort" and "twist." "Distort" means to alter something in a way that is misleading or unnatural, which is similar to "twist," meaning to bend or turn something out of its original shape. Based on this relationship, the correct analogy would be: C. Harmonize: Balance Explanation: Just as "distort" means to twist or change something from its original form, "harmonize" refers to bringing things into a pleasing or congruent arrangement, which is similar to "balance," meaning to bring different elements into a correct proportion or relation. Both pairs involve the alteration of a state or condition to achieve a certain effect - "distort" and "twist" in a negative or misleading way, and "harmonize" and "balance" in a positive or congruent way.

questions.question: What percentage of profit is made by selling an article at a certain price if by selling at two third of that price these would be a loss of 20%?
questions.explanation: Solve: Let, certain price = 300 t k =300 \mathrm{tk} = 300 tk ‚à¥ 300 √ó 2 3 = 200 t k ‚à¥ 80 ‚Üí 200 t k \begin{array}{l} \therefore 300 \times \frac{2}{3}=200 \mathrm{tk} \\ \therefore 80 \rightarrow 200 \mathrm{tk} \end{array} ‚à¥ 300 √ó 3 2 ‚Äã = 200 tk ‚à¥ 80 ‚Üí 200 tk ‚Äã ‚à¥ 1 ‚Üí 200 80 t k ‚à¥ 100 ‚Üí 200 √ó 100 80 t k = 250 t k ‚à¥ 250 t k ‚Üí 50 t k profit { 300 ‚àí 250 = 50 } ‚à¥ 1 t k ‚Üí 50 250 t k profit ‚à¥ 100 t k ‚Üí 50 √ó 100 250 t k profit = 20 t k e = 20 % \begin{array}{l}\therefore 1 \rightarrow \frac{200}{80} \mathrm{tk} \\ \therefore 100 \rightarrow \frac{200 \times 100}{80} \mathrm{tk} \\ =250 \mathrm{tk} \\ \therefore 250 \mathrm{tk} \rightarrow 50 \mathrm{tk} \text { profit }\{300-250=50\} \\ \therefore 1 \mathrm{tk} \rightarrow \frac{50}{250} \mathrm{tk} \text { profit } \\ \therefore 100 \mathrm{tk} \rightarrow \frac{50 \times 100}{250} \mathrm{tk} \text { profit }=20 \mathrm{tke}=20 \%\end{array} ‚à¥ 1 ‚Üí 80 200 ‚Äã tk ‚à¥ 100 ‚Üí 80 200 √ó 100 ‚Äã tk = 250 tk ‚à¥ 250 tk ‚Üí 50 tk profit { 300 ‚àí 250 = 50 } ‚à¥ 1 tk ‚Üí 250 50 ‚Äã tk profit ‚à¥ 100 tk ‚Üí 250 50 √ó 100 ‚Äã tk profit = 20 tke = 20% ‚Äã

questions.question: Before anybody could notice. Arif took 1/3 of the chocolates from a box. Later, his three sisters arried and the remaining chocolates were distributed equally among the four of them. Arif received a total of total 48 chocolates. How many did each of her sisters receive?
questions.explanation: Solve: Total chocolate = x =x = x First of all Arif took = x 3 =\frac{x}{3} = 3 x ‚Äã The rest are left = x ‚àí x 3 = 2 x 3 =x-\frac{x}{3}=\frac{2 x}{3} = x ‚àí 3 x ‚Äã = 3 2 x ‚Äã Eueryone in the rest gets = 2 x 3 √∑ 4 = 2 x 12 =\frac{2 x}{3} \div 4=\frac{2 x}{12} = 3 2 x ‚Äã √∑ 4 = 12 2 x ‚Äã ‚à¥ \therefore ‚à¥ Arif tooks = x 3 + 2 x 12 = 6 x 12 =\frac{x}{3}+\frac{2 x}{12}=\frac{6 x}{12} = 3 x ‚Äã + 12 2 x ‚Äã = 12 6 x ‚Äã . ‚à¥ 6 x 12 = 48 = x = 96 \therefore \frac{6 x}{12}=48=\mathrm{x}=96 ‚à¥ 12 6 x ‚Äã = 48 = x = 96 Then Arifs every sister get = 2 x 12 = 2 Àô √ó 96 12 = 16 =\frac{2 \mathrm{x}}{12}=\frac{\dot{2} \times 96}{12}=16 = 12 2 x ‚Äã = 12 2 Àô √ó 96 ‚Äã = 16

questions.question: The sum of 6 consecutive odd integers exceeds twice the biggest integers by 38. Find sum of the six numbers?
P is a set of 5 consecutive integers whose average is 4. Q is a set of 7 consecutive integers whose average is 7. How many numbers of set Q are also members of set P?
questions.explanation: Solve: There are 5 serial numbers is the p Set- x , x + 1 , x + 2 , x + 3 , x + 4 ‚à¥ x + x + 1 + x + 2 + x + 3 + x + 4 = 4 √ó 5 ‚áí 5 x + 10 = 20 ‚à¥ x = 2 ‚à¥ P = ( 2 , 3 , 4 , 5 , 6 ) Q = ( 4 , 5 , 6 , 7 , 8 , 9 , 10 ) ‚à¥ P and Q = ( 4 , 5 , 6 ) ‚à¥ Total Common numbers = 3 \begin{array}{l} \text { p Set- } x, x+1, x+2, x+3, x+4 \\ \therefore x+x+1+x+2+x+3+x+4=4 \times 5 \\ \Rightarrow 5 x+10=20 \therefore x=2 \\ \therefore P=(2,3,4,5,6) \\ Q=(4,5,6,7,8,9,10) \\ \therefore P \text { and } Q=(4,5,6) \\ \therefore \text { Total Common numbers }=3 \end{array} p Set- x , x + 1 , x + 2 , x + 3 , x + 4 ‚à¥ x + x + 1 + x + 2 + x + 3 + x + 4 = 4 √ó 5 ‚áí 5 x + 10 = 20 ‚à¥ x = 2 ‚à¥ P = ( 2 , 3 , 4 , 5 , 6 ) Q = ( 4 , 5 , 6 , 7 , 8 , 9 , 10 ) ‚à¥ P and Q = ( 4 , 5 , 6 ) ‚à¥ Total Common numbers = 3 ‚Äã

Sum of five consecutive integers is 45. How many of these integers are prime numbers?
questions.explanation: Solve: There are 5 serial numbers x , x + 1 , x + 2 , x + 3 , x + 4 ‚áí x + x + 1 + x + 2 + x + 3 + x + 4 = 45 ‚áí 5 x + 10 = 45 ‚à¥ x = 6 \begin{array}{l} \text { Solve: There are } 5 \text { serial numbers } \\ x, x+1, x+2, x+3, x+4 \\ \Rightarrow x+x+1+x+2+x+3+x+4=45 \\ \Rightarrow 5 x+10=45 \therefore x=6 \end{array} Solve: There are 5 serial numbers x , x + 1 , x + 2 , x + 3 , x + 4 ‚áí x + x + 1 + x + 2 + x + 3 + x + 4 = 45 ‚áí 5 x + 10 = 45 ‚à¥ x = 6 ‚Äã Full serial numbers are = 6 , 7 , 8 , 9 , 10 =6,7,8,9,10 = 6 , 7 , 8 , 9 , 10 Whoever there are 1 Prime numbers here = 7 =7 = 7 ‚à¥ \therefore ‚à¥ Prime numbers = 1 =1 = 1

questions.explanation: 7 x ‚àí 5 y = 13 ‚àí ‚Ä¶ ‚àí ( i ) 2 x ‚àí 7 y = 26 ‚àí ‚Ä¶ ‚àí (ii) \begin{array}{r} 7 x-5 y=13-\ldots-(i) \\ 2 x-7 y=26-\ldots-\text { (ii) } \end{array} 7 x ‚àí 5 y = 13 ‚àí ‚Ä¶ ‚àí ( i ) 2 x ‚àí 7 y = 26 ‚àí ‚Ä¶ ‚àí (ii) ‚Äã Number (i) multiply with number (ii) and (iii multiplay by 7 and get it added. multiplay 14 x ‚àí 10 y = 26 ‚Ä¶ ‚àí ‚Ä¶ 14 x ‚àí 49 y = 182 ‚Ä¶ ‚àí ‚Ä¶ (iv) 39 y = ‚àí 156 y ‚à¥ y = ‚àí 4 ‡•§ \begin{array}{l} \text { multiplay } \\ 14 \mathrm{x}-10 \mathrm{y}=26 \ldots-\ldots \\ 14 \mathrm{x}-49 \mathrm{y}=182 \ldots-\ldots \text { (iv) } \\ \hline 39 \mathrm{y}=-156 \mathrm{y} \\ \therefore \mathrm{y}=-4 \text { ‡•§ } \end{array} multiplay 14 x ‚àí 10 y = 26 ‚Ä¶ ‚àí ‚Ä¶ 14 x ‚àí 49 y = 182 ‚Ä¶ ‚àí ‚Ä¶ (iv) 39 y = ‚àí 156 y ‚à¥ y = ‚àí 4 ‡•§ ‚Äã ‚Äã (i) ‡¶®‡¶Ç ‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡ßÄ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶£‡ßá y ‡¶è‡¶∞ ‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶® ‡¶¨‡¶∏‡¶ø‡¶Ø‡¶º‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶á, 7 x ‚àí 5 ( 4 ) = 13 ‚áí x = ‚àí 1 ‚à¥ 9 x ‚àí 12 y = 9 ( ‚àí 1 ) ‚àí 12 ( ‚àí 4 ) = ‚àí 9 + 48 = 39 \begin{array}{l} 7 x-5(4)=13 \\ \Rightarrow x=-1 \\ \therefore 9 x-12 y=9(-1)-12(-4)=-9+48=39 \end{array} 7 x ‚àí 5 ( 4 ) = 13 ‚áí x = ‚àí 1 ‚à¥ 9 x ‚àí 12 y = 9 ( ‚àí 1 ) ‚àí 12 ( ‚àí 4 ) = ‚àí 9 + 48 = 39 ‚Äã

questions.explanation: Solve: Let, every pasia have x x x coins According to Questions, x 10 + x 4 + x 2 = 170 \frac{x}{10}+\frac{x}{4}+\frac{x}{2}=170 10 x ‚Äã + 4 x ‚Äã + 2 x ‚Äã = 170 or, x = 200 x=200 x = 200
